job_title: Chief of Police in Wilberforce, OH
pros: Small private campus with a family feel
cons: Funding is low for department budgets but we are still able to manage so its not really a con just a  reason to find other means such as grants to  attain things.
Low funds, Older employees need to transition

pros: Most of the employees are really nice
cons: The senior leaders are inept and lack basic leadership skills

pros: The appreciate from the students on how you (as a professor) care about not only their class performance but also them as individuals and their success to the university
cons: Adjunct Professors were often kept out of the loop on events affecting the university.  Adjunct Professors were treated differently based on the fulltime and Adjunct status.  Communication to ensure classrooms and other resources were available to facilitate a class

review_title: At first I was apprehensive about working at a HBCU, But the curriculum is modern-focused and cloud based.
pros: The school is technology focused and new innovative techniques are used for the learning environment. The schools seems to focus a lot of finances towards new learning management systems.
cons: Low student enrollment. All the tools are there for a full class. But most courses consist of 4-6 students, and sometimes students enroll late in the courses and things can get behind.

review_title: There's nowhere to go but up.... literally, it can't get any worse.
pros: It's a small environment, and many coworkers felt like family.
cons:
Declining enrollment and questionable financial management by the administration has left the school with an uncertain outlook.

The outdated equipment and crumbling buildings are why I sought other employment.

review_title: Taught as an Adjunct, Psychology of Exceptional Children
pros: Professors and students take learning very serious at Wilberforce University. The school hang its hat on integrity and unity.
cons: Financial difficulties; the school is in need of more donations and scholarship programs made available for their students.

pros: Some students are fairly well prepared for this level of education, but many are not.  Faculty is committed to serving the students and community.
cons: Salaries are far below the national standards for an institution of higher learning.  Facilities are poor and fiscal management could be improved.
